revised_title: Tides, Wells, and Whale Fishing in Bermuda
tldr: This letter from Richard Norwood describes the tides and wells in Bermuda, as well as the local whale hunting practices. He mentions that the tides are influenced by the sea level and that wells near the sea have both fresh and salt water. He also discusses the whale hunting techniques and the discovery of spermaceti in some whales. The letter provides valuable information about the natural resources and marine life in Bermuda.
